Package it.polimi.ingsw.PSP38.common.utilities

Class ArgumentChecker

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.PSP38.common.utilities.ArgumentChecker
public final class ArgumentChecker
extends java.lang.Object
Non instantiable class that provides methods used to control whether arguments are valid or not.
Author:
Maximilien Groh (10683107)

  • Method Details

    • requireBetween

      public static int requireBetween​(int lowerBound, int upperBound, int value) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Verifies that a given value is inside a certain range. If it is not the case, it throws an IllegalArgumentException.
      Parameters:
      lowerBound - Lower bound of the range
      upperBound - Upper bound of the range
      value - Integer that must be checked
      Returns:
      the given value
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if (value < lowerBound || value >= upperBound)

    • checkXCoordinate

      public static int checkXCoordinate​(int x) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Verifies that the given x coordinate is not out of bounds. If it is not the case, it throws an IllegalArgumentException.
      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate
      Returns:
      the given value
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value is outside of the board's boundaries

    • checkYCoordinate

      Returns:
      the given value

    • checkAge

      public static int checkAge​(int age) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Verifies that the value is between Player.MIN_AGE and Player.MAX_AGE. If it is not the case, it throws an IllegalArgumentException.
      Parameters:
      age - the value to check
      Returns:
      the given value
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value is outside of the given boundaries

    • checkYesOrNo

      public static java.lang.String checkYesOrNo​(java.lang.String answer) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Verifies that the given string is equal to "yes" or "no". If it is not the case, it throws an IllegalArgumentException.
      Parameters:
      answer - the string to check
      Returns:
      the given string
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value is not equal to "yes" or "no"

    • checkNeighbor

      public static void checkNeighbor​(Worker worker, Cell destinationCell, Board currentBoard) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Verifies that the worker's position is adjacent to the given cell. If it is not the case, it throws an IllegalArgumentException.
      Parameters:
      worker - the worker
      destinationCell - the cell to check
      currentBoard - the board containing the cells
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given cell isn't adjacent to the cell on which the worker is standing

    • checkDome

      public static void checkDome​(Cell destinationCell, Board currentBoard) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Verifies that the board doesn't contain a dome on the given cell. If it does, it throws an IllegalArgumentException.
      Parameters:
      destinationCell - the cell to check
      currentBoard - the board containing the cells
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the board contains a dome on the given cell

      destinationCell - the cell to check
      currentBoard - the board containing the cells
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the height difference between the given cell and the cell on which the worker is standing is greater than 1.

    • checkWorkerSameColor

      public static void checkWorkerSameColor​(Worker worker, Cell destinationCell, Board currentBoard) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Verifies that the board doesn't contain a worker of the same color of the given worker on the cell given as parameter. If it does, it throws an IllegalArgumentException.
      Parameters:
      worker - the worker
      destinationCell - the cell to check
      currentBoard - the board containing the cells
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given cell contains a worker of the same color as the one given as parameter.
